citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, there was no documented program of environmental enhancement available for review, for the
non-human primates housed at the facility. An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting
the psychological well-being of non-human primates. Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document,
and follow an appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-
human primates. This plan must be made available to APHIS upon request. To be corrected by March 22, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
HARVEY KENT, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.81 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At the time of inspection, there was no documented program of environmental enhancement available for review, for the 
non-human primates housed at the facility. An adequate environmental enhancement program is essential in promoting 
the psychological well-being of non-human primates. Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, 
and follow an appropriate plan for environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of non-
human primates. This plan must be made available to APHIS upon request. To be corrected by March 22, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
HARVEY KENT, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
